meanings.definition: The quality or state of being degradable.
meanings.sent1: The degradabilities of certain materials make them environmentally friendly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the degradabilities of different substances to understand their impact on nature.
meanings.sent3: The degradabilities of these biodegradable bags make them a hit at the eco-friendly store.
meanings.sent4: The degradabilities of our resolve in the face of challenges determine our strength.
meanings.sent5: The degradabilities of memories fade over time, like footprints in the sand.

meanings.definition: The ability to be broken down or decomposed.
meanings.sent1: Composting relies on the degradabilities of organic matter to turn into nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: Landfills are designed to take advantage of the degradabilities of waste materials.
meanings.sent3: The degradabilities of these food scraps in the compost bin are truly impressive.
meanings.sent4: The degradabilities of old buildings in the city symbolize the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The degradabilities of rock formations reveal the power of erosion over centuries.
